oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-05-21 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 21, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hawkshaw Hawkins (host/performer), guest performer Patsy Cline (although Jean Shepard was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Archie Campbell, and Stringbean. The Michigan Week queens of Kay Seidelman (Honey Queen), Melissa Beth Tornberg (Cherry Queen), Carol Kay Peterson (Apple Queen), and Carolyn Peyerk (Bean Queen), also appear as guests. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1076th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hawkshaw Hawkins; Jordanaires; Patsy Cline; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hawkshaw Hawkins -- Patanio (The Pride Of The Plains) (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces the Jordanaires -- Sit Down (Jordanaires) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Patsy Cline -- How Can I Face Tomorrow (Patsy Cline) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Tommy Jackson -- Bill Cheatham (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner and Hawkshaw Hawkins talk -- Amazing Grace (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Chet Atkins -- El Relicario (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Jackson, Tommy; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jordanaires (Musical group); Campbell, Archie; Hawkins, Hawkshaw, 1921-1963; Cline, Patsy, 1932-1963; Husky, Ferlin
